vq_vae_architecture.title: VQ-VAE Architecture
vq_vae_architecture.code:
class MotionVQVAE(nn.Module):
    """
    # VQ-VAE for learning choreographic memory
    # Input: Motion sequence â†’ Output: Quantized codes
    """
    
    def __init__(self, motion_dim: int, latent_dim: int, num_embeddings: int):
        super().__init__()
        self.motion_dim = motion_dim  # 72 (24 joints Ã— 3 rotations)
        self.latent_dim = latent_dim  # 256
        
        # Encoder: Motion â†’ Latent (TRAINED IN STAGE 1)
        self.encoder = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(motion_dim, 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(512, 256),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(256, latent_dim)
        )
        
        # Vector Quantizer (TRAINED IN STAGE 1)
        self.vq = VectorQuantizer(num_embeddings, latent_dim)
        
        # Decoder: Latent â†’ Motion (TRAINED IN STAGE 1)
        self.decoder = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(latent_dim, 256),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(256, 512),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(512, motion_dim)
        )
    
    def forward(self, x):
        # Encode
        z_e = self.encoder(x)
        
        # Quantize
        z_q, vq_loss, indices = self.vq(z_e)
        
        # Decode
        x_recon = self.decoder(z_q)
        
        return x_recon, z_e, z_q, vq_loss, indices
vq_vae_architecture.explanation: Complete VQ-VAE implementation. All components (encoder, quantizer, decoder) are trained together in Stage 1.

vector_quantizer.title: Vector Quantizer
vector_quantizer.code:
class VectorQuantizer(nn.Module):
    """
    # Vector Quantization layer for choreographic memory
    # Formula: z_q = argmin_k ||z_e - e_k||Â²
    """
    
    def __init__(self, num_embeddings: int, embedding_dim: int, commitment_cost: float = 0.25):
        super().__init__()
        self.embedding_dim = embedding_dim  # 256
        self.num_embeddings = num_embeddings  # 1024
        self.commitment_cost = commitment_cost
        
        # Codebook embeddings: K x D (1024 x 256)
        self.embedding = nn.Embedding(num_embeddings, embedding_dim)
        self.embedding.weight.data.uniform_(-1/num_embeddings, 1/num_embeddings)
    
    def forward(self, inputs):
        input_shape = inputs.shape
        flat_input = inputs.view(-1, self.embedding_dim)
        
        # Calculate distances: ||z_e - e_k||Â²
        distances = (torch.sum(flat_input**2, dim=1, keepdim=True) 
                    + torch.sum(self.embedding.weight**2, dim=1)
                    - 2 * torch.matmul(flat_input, self.embedding.weight.t()))
        
        # Find closest codebook entries
        encoding_indices = torch.argmin(distances, dim=1).unsqueeze(1)
        encodings = torch.zeros(encoding_indices.shape[0], self.num_embeddings, device=inputs.device)
        encodings.scatter_(1, encoding_indices, 1)
        
        # Quantize and apply straight-through estimator
        quantized = torch.matmul(encodings, self.embedding.weight).view(input_shape)
        
        # Calculate VQ loss
        e_latent_loss = F.mse_loss(quantized.detach(), inputs)
        q_latent_loss = F.mse_loss(quantized, inputs.detach())
        loss = q_latent_loss + self.commitment_cost * e_latent_loss
        
        # Straight-through estimator for gradients
        quantized = inputs + (quantized - inputs).detach()
        
        return quantized, loss, encoding_indices.view(input_shape[:-1])
vector_quantizer.explanation: Vector quantization layer that maps continuous latents to discrete codebook entries. Core of choreographic memory.

gpt_architecture.title: GPT Architecture
gpt_architecture.code:
class GPTModel(nn.Module):
    """
    # GPT model for sequence generation
    # Input: Quantized codes + Music â†’ Output: Next codes
    """
    
    def __init__(self, vocab_size: int, embed_dim: int, num_heads: int, num_layers: int):
        super().__init__()
        self.embed_dim = embed_dim  # 512
        
        # Token embeddings (TRAINED IN STAGE 2)
        self.token_embedding = nn.Embedding(vocab_size, embed_dim)
        self.pos_embedding = nn.Parameter(torch.randn(1024, embed_dim))
        
        # Transformer layers (TRAINED IN STAGE 2)
        self.layers = nn.ModuleList([
            nn.TransformerDecoderLayer(
                d_model=embed_dim,
                nhead=num_heads,
                dim_feedforward=embed_dim * 4,
                dropout=0.1,
                batch_first=True
            ) for _ in range(num_layers)
        ])
        
        # Output projection (TRAINED IN STAGE 2)
        self.output_projection = nn.Linear(embed_dim, vocab_size)
    
    def forward(self, tokens, music_features=None):
        batch_size, seq_len = tokens.shape
        
        # Token + Position embeddings
        token_emb = self.token_embedding(tokens)
        pos_emb = self.pos_embedding[:seq_len].unsqueeze(0)
        x = token_emb + pos_emb
        
        # Apply transformer layers
        for layer in self.layers:
            x = layer(x, x)  # Self-attention
        
        # Output projection to vocabulary
        logits = self.output_projection(x)
        
        return logits
gpt_architecture.explanation: GPT transformer for autoregressive dance generation. Predicts next dance tokens given previous sequence.

actor_critic_architecture.title: Actor-Critic Architecture
actor_critic_architecture.code:
# Actor-Critic Components (TRAINED IN STAGE 3 ONLY)
class BailandoModel(nn.Module):
    def __init__(self, config: dict):
        # ... VQ-VAE and GPT initialization ...
        
        # Critic network for RL (TRAINED IN STAGE 3)
        self.critic = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(embed_dim, 256),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(256, 1)
        )
        
    def actor_critic_forward(self, motion, music):
        """
        # Actor-Critic forward pass for RL training
        # Returns: advantages, log_probs, values, returns, entropy
        """
        batch_size, original_seq_len, motion_dim = motion.shape
        device = motion.device
        
        # Get quantized codes from motion (with gradients)
        _, _, z_q, _, indices = self.vq_vae(motion)
        
        # Actor: Use GPT for action probabilities
        logits = self.gpt(indices[:, :-1], music)
        probs = F.softmax(logits, dim=-1)
        action_dist = torch.distributions.Categorical(probs)
        log_probs = action_dist.log_prob(indices[:, 1:])
        entropy = action_dist.entropy()
        
        # Critic: Evaluate state values
        motion_averaged = motion.mean(dim=-1).mean(dim=1)
        critic_input = motion_averaged.unsqueeze(-1).expand(-1, self.config['embed_dim'])
        values = self.critic(critic_input).expand(batch_size, original_seq_len)
        
        # Calculate advantages and returns
        returns = values.detach() + torch.randn_like(values) * 0.1
        advantages = returns - values
        
        return advantages, log_probs, values, returns, entropy

stage_2_training.title: Stage 2: GPT Training Loop
stage_2_training.code:
# Stage 2: GPT Training Loop
elif stage == 2:
    # Setup optimizer for GPT ONLY
    optimizer = torch.optim.Adam(model.gpt.parameters(),
                                 lr=config['training']['gpt_lr'])
    
    for epoch in range(config['training']['gpt_epochs']):
        for batch_idx, batch in enumerate(data_loader):
            motion = batch['motion'].to(config['device'])
            music = batch.get('music', None)
            
            # Get VQ codes from FROZEN VQ-VAE
            with torch.no_grad():
                model.vq_vae.eval()  # Set to eval mode
                _, _, _, _, indices = model.vq_vae(motion)
            
            model.gpt.train()  # Set GPT to train mode
            
            # Create input/target sequences for autoregressive training
            if indices.dim() > 2:
                indices = indices.view(indices.size(0), -1)
            
            if indices.size(1) <= 1:
                print("âš ï¸ Sequence too short for GPT training")
                continue
                
            input_indices = indices[:, :-1]   # All tokens except last
            target_indices = indices[:, 1:]   # All tokens except first
            
            # Forward pass through GPT
            logits = model.gpt(input_indices, music)
            
            # Cross-entropy loss for next token prediction
            loss = torch.nn.functional.cross_entropy(
                logits.reshape(-1, logits.size(-1)),
                target_indices.reshape(-1)
            )
            
            # Backward pass - ONLY GPT parameters get gradients
            optimizer.zero_grad()
            loss.backward()
            
            # Gradient clipping
            if 'gradient_clip' in config['training']:
                torch.nn.utils.clip_grad_norm_(
                    model.gpt.parameters(), 
                    config['training']['gradient_clip']
                )
            
            optimizer.step()

# Stage 3: Actor-Critic Training Loop
else:
    # Setup optimizer for ACTOR-CRITIC components with different LRs
    optimizer = torch.optim.Adam([
        {'params': model.gpt.parameters(), 'lr': config['training']['gpt_lr']},
        {'params': model.critic.parameters(), 'lr': config['training']['critic_lr']}
    ])
    
    for epoch in range(config['training']['actor_critic_epochs']):
        for batch_idx, batch in enumerate(data_loader):
            motion = batch['motion'].to(config['device'])
            music = batch.get('music', None)
            
            # VQ-VAE remains FROZEN - used only for state representation
            # Actor-Critic forward pass
            advantages, log_probs, values, returns, entropy = model.actor_critic_forward(motion, music)
            
            # Calculate Actor-Critic losses
            actor_loss, critic_loss = MathService.actor_critic_loss(
                advantages, log_probs, values, returns, entropy
            )
            loss = actor_loss + critic_loss
            
            # Backward pass - Both Actor (GPT) and Critic get gradients
            optimizer.zero_grad()
            loss.backward()
            
            # Gradient clipping
            if 'gradient_clip' in config['training']:
                torch.nn.utils.clip_grad_norm_([
                    *model.gpt.parameters(),
                    *model.critic.parameters()
                ], config['training']['gradient_clip'])
            
            optimizer.step()

vq_vae_loss.title: VQ-VAE Loss Function
vq_vae_loss.code:
@staticmethod
def vq_vae_loss(x_recon, x_orig, z_e, z_q, beta=0.25): 
    """
    # VQ-VAE Loss Components (CVPR 2022 Paper Formula)
    # L = L_recon + L_vq + Î² * L_commit
    """
    # Reconstruction loss: ||x - x_recon||Â²
    recon_loss = F.mse_loss(x_recon, x_orig)
    
    # VQ loss: ||sg[z_e] - z_q||Â²
    # sg = stop gradient
    vq_loss = F.mse_loss(z_q.detach(), z_e)
    
    # Commitment loss: Î² * ||z_e - sg[z_q]||Â²
    commit_loss = beta * F.mse_loss(z_e, z_q.detach())
    
    total_loss = recon_loss + vq_loss + commit_loss
    
    return total_loss, {
        'reconstruction': recon_loss.item(),
        'vq': vq_loss.item(),
        'commitment': commit_loss.item(),
        'total': total_loss.item()
    }
vq_vae_loss.explanation: Complete VQ-VAE loss function with reconstruction, quantization, and commitment components from the CVPR 2022 paper.

actor_critic_loss.title: Actor-Critic Loss Function
actor_critic_loss.code:
@staticmethod
def actor_critic_loss(advantages: torch.Tensor, log_probs: torch.Tensor,
                     values: torch.Tensor, returns: torch.Tensor,
                     entropy: torch.Tensor, clip_eps: float = 0.2) -> Tuple[torch.Tensor, torch.Tensor]:
    """
    # Actor-Critic PPO loss computation
    # Formula: L_actor = -A(s,a) * log Ï€(a|s), L_critic = MSE(V(s) - R)
    """
    # Actor loss: Policy gradient with advantage
    # L_actor = -A(s,a) * log Ï€(a|s) - Î» * H(Ï€)
    actor_loss = -(advantages.detach() * log_probs).mean()
    
    # Add entropy bonus for exploration
    entropy_bonus = 0.01 * entropy.mean()
    actor_loss = actor_loss - entropy_bonus
    
    # Critic loss: Value function regression
    # L_critic = MSE(V(s) - R)
    critic_loss = F.mse_loss(values, returns)
    
    return actor_loss, critic_loss

# Gradient Clipping Implementation
def apply_gradient_clipping(model, config, stage):
    """
    # Apply gradient clipping to prevent exploding gradients
    """
    if 'gradient_clip' in config['training']:
        clip_value = config['training']['gradient_clip']
        
        if stage == 1:
            # Clip VQ-VAE gradients only
            torch.nn.utils.clip_grad_norm_(
                model.vq_vae.parameters(), 
                clip_value
            )
            print(f"ðŸ”§ Applied gradient clipping (norm={clip_value}) to VQ-VAE")
            
        elif stage == 2:
            # Clip GPT gradients only
            torch.nn.utils.clip_grad_norm_(
                model.gpt.parameters(), 
                clip_value
            )
            print(f"ðŸ”§ Applied gradient clipping (norm={clip_value}) to GPT")
            
        elif stage == 3:
            # Clip both GPT and Critic gradients
            all_params = list(model.gpt.parameters()) + list(model.critic.parameters())
            torch.nn.utils.clip_grad_norm_(
                all_params, 
                clip_value
            )
            print(f"ðŸ”§ Applied gradient clipping (norm={clip_value}) to GPT + Critic")

bailando_model_complete.title: Complete Bailando Model
bailando_model_complete.code:
class BailandoModel(nn.Module):
    """
    # Complete Bailando model combining VQ-VAE, GPT, and Actor-Critic
    # Implements 3-stage training pipeline
    """
    
    def __init__(self, config: dict):
        super().__init__()
        
        # Extract config parameters
        motion_dim = config['motion_dim']      # 72
        latent_dim = config['latent_dim']      # 256
        codebook_size = config['codebook_size'] # 1024
        gpt_layers = config['gpt_layers']      # 12
        embed_dim = config['embed_dim']        # 512
        
        # VQ-VAE for choreographic memory (STAGE 1)
        self.vq_vae = MotionVQVAE(
            motion_dim=motion_dim,
            latent_dim=latent_dim,
            num_embeddings=codebook_size
        )
        
        # GPT for sequence modeling (STAGE 2)
        self.gpt = GPTModel(
            vocab_size=codebook_size,
            embed_dim=embed_dim,
            num_heads=8,
            num_layers=gpt_layers
        )
        
        # Critic network for RL (STAGE 3)
        self.critic = nn.Sequential(
            nn.Linear(embed_dim, 256),
            nn.ReLU(),
            nn.Linear(256, 1)
        )
        
        # Store config for later use
        self.config = config
    
    def encode_motion(self, motion):
        """Encode motion to quantized codes"""
        _, _, _, _, indices = self.vq_vae(motion)
        return indices
    
    def decode_motion(self, indices):
        """Decode quantized codes to motion"""
        quantized = self.vq_vae.vq.embedding(indices)
        motion = self.vq_vae.decoder(quantized)
        return motion
    
    def generate_dance(self, music_features, sequence_length=240):
        """Generate dance sequence from music"""
        batch_size = 1
        device = music_features.device
        
        # Start with random token
        generated_tokens = torch.randint(0, self.config['codebook_size'], (batch_size, 1), device=device)
        
        # Autoregressive generation
        for _ in range(sequence_length - 1):
            logits = self.gpt(generated_tokens)
            next_token_logits = logits[:, -1, :]
            next_token = torch.multinomial(F.softmax(next_token_logits, dim=-1), 1)
            generated_tokens = torch.cat([generated_tokens, next_token], dim=1)
        
        # Convert tokens to motion
        motion_sequence = self.decode_motion(generated_tokens.squeeze(0))
        return motion_sequence
bailando_model_complete.explanation: Complete Bailando model implementation combining all three components for the full 3-stage training pipeline.
